conversations.description: User asks for a 14‑day demand forecast for SKU 12345, LLM loads sales, promotions, seasonality, runs forecast, and returns the numbers.
Manager requests a PDF report for the next month’s inventory needs of product A100, including confidence bands and reorder recommendations.
Supply‑chain analyst wants to compare forecast accuracy between two promotion strategies for SKU 67890 and see which yields lower stock‑out risk.
Regional planner asks the LLM to simulate a 20% price discount for the upcoming holiday week and see the impact on forecasted demand.
Operations lead needs an alert sent to the warehouse team if projected inventory for SKU 55555 falls below the safety stock threshold in the next 7 days.
User requests a batch forecast for all SKUs in the "Beverages" category for the next 30 days, receiving a consolidated CSV summary.
Executive asks for a dashboard view showing top‑5 at‑risk items across all categories for the next two weeks.
Procurement officer wants to know the recommended reorder quantity for SKU 99999 given current on‑hand stock and the 14‑day forecast.
Marketing team wants to see how a planned 2‑week “Buy‑One‑Get‑One” promotion will shift the demand curve for product C200.
User asks the LLM to pull historic sales for SKU 44444 from Jan 1 2022 to Dec 31 2023 and plot a seasonality heat‑map.
Logistics coordinator requests an alert if any SKU’s forecasted demand spikes more than 30% compared to the previous week.
Finance department asks for a cost‑impact analysis of potential stock‑outs for high‑margin items over the next month.
User wants to see a side‑by‑side forecast for SKU 77777 with and without the upcoming summer promotion.
Operations manager asks for a 7‑day rolling forecast update every morning, delivered via Slack.
Product manager asks the LLM to forecast demand for a newly launched SKU using only analogous category seasonality and no sales history.
User requests a scenario where the promotion calendar is shifted one week later and wants the revised inventory forecast.
Supply‑chain analyst asks for a short‑term forecast (5 days) for a perishable SKU, with a recommendation to reduce order size.
User wants the LLM to generate a visual report that highlights days with predicted demand exceeding warehouse capacity.
Regional director asks for a comparison of forecasts between two stores for the same SKU to identify regional demand variance.
User asks the LLM to combine forecasts for multiple SKUs into a single replenishment plan for the next 21 days.
Marketing wants an email alert summarizing the expected uplift from a planned Black‑Friday promotion for several top‑selling SKUs.
Operations lead requests a forecast that incorporates a sudden supply disruption, reducing forecasted inventory availability by 15%.
User asks for a forecast that excludes any promotions, to understand baseline demand for SKU 22222.
Finance asks for a projected cash‑flow impact based on forecasted sales and planned discounts for the next quarter.
User wants an alert if the forecasted inventory for any SKU falls below the reorder point within the next 10 days.
Supply‑chain planner asks for a “what‑if” simulation where a new competitor enters the market, reducing demand by 5%.
User requests a PDF report that includes a Gantt‑style timeline of upcoming promotions and corresponding demand forecasts.
Operations manager asks for a daily forecast email that also shows the variance between forecast and actual sales recorded so far.
User wants the LLM to forecast demand for a SKU using only the most recent 90‑day sales window to capture recent trends.
Regional head asks for a heat‑map of forecasted stock‑out risk across all stores for a key product line.
User asks for a summary of the top three drivers (seasonality, promotions, historical trend) influencing the forecast for SKU 33333.
Procurement wants the LLM to recommend the optimal reorder date for a SKU based on lead time and the forecasted demand curve.
User requests a Slack alert when a forecasted demand surge coincides with a planned production downtime.
Marketing asks the LLM to estimate incremental sales from a proposed 15% discount for a weekend sale, adjusting the forecast accordingly.
User wants to export the forecast data for SKU 88888 into an Excel file for further analysis.
Operations director asks for a consolidated report showing forecasted inventory levels for all high‑velocity SKUs over the next 60 days.
User asks the LLM to generate a visual chart comparing actual sales vs. forecast for the past three months for a given SKU.
Supply‑chain analyst wants an alert if the predicted demand exceeds the maximum storage capacity of a specific warehouse.
User requests a forecast that assumes a new loyalty program will increase repeat purchases by 8% for the next month.
Finance asks for a scenario where the cost of goods rises 10%, affecting reorder quantities in the forecast report.
User asks the LLM to forecast demand for a seasonal product only during its active months, skipping off‑season days.
Operations manager wants a weekly PDF report that includes a “risk rating” for each SKU based on forecast volatility.
User asks for a quick one‑click forecast for any SKU by just providing the product ID, receiving a 7‑day demand list.
Regional planner requests an alert if two promotions overlap for the same SKU, potentially causing a demand spike.
User wants the LLM to compare forecasted demand for the current quarter against the same quarter last year for trend analysis.
Supply‑chain lead asks for a consolidated Slack digest of all alerts generated in the past day for low‑stock SKUs.
User asks for a recommendation on how many extra units to buffer for a high‑risk SKU during a major holiday period.
Marketing asks the LLM to predict the uplift from a social‑media campaign scheduled next week for selected SKUs.
User requests a forecast that incorporates a potential supplier lead‑time increase of 3 days for a critical component.
Operations manager wants a visual timeline that aligns forecasted demand peaks with planned delivery schedules.
User asks for a PDF summarizing forecast confidence intervals for each day of the 30‑day horizon for a given SKU.
Supply‑chain analyst wants a scenario where a planned promotion is canceled, and the forecast is adjusted accordingly.
User requests an email alert highlighting SKUs that are projected to have a stock‑out risk greater than 70% in the next two weeks.
Finance asks for a forecast‑driven projection of gross margin impact based on expected discount levels for upcoming promotions.
User wants a quick summary of the recommended reorder quantity for all SKUs that will be out of stock within the next five days.
